title: Inside CID: The real reasons nobody wants to be a detective any more
text:
To get into CID it used to be that you had to climb over dead bodies because it was the job everyone wanted,” says detective Karen Stephens.

She joined CID when TV heroes such as Inspector Morse, DCI Gene Hunt and DCI Jane Tennison had fired the public imagination about detective work as the pinnacle of British policing.

DC Stephens, secretary of the Police Federation’s national detectives forum, remains passionate about the buzz of nailing a villain: “When you get that guilty verdict in court, it’s just the best feeling. You see the victims and they are overwhelmed.”
